title: Exploring Well-being Through Art: Creative Project-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience in artistic activities and general understanding of wellness concepts
context.additional_context: Conducted as smartphone-based asynchronous learning, involving projects that connect individual well-being goals with artistic creation

learning_goals: Learners can self-assess their personal well-being state through the artistic creation process and develop three or more specific improvement plans.

Learners can conduct artistic experiments (e.g., drawing, collage, sound art) twice or more weekly using a PBL approach and apply science-based well-being principles (e.g., sensory stimulation, cognitive restructuring).
Learners can produce one or more artworks based on peer feedback and self-reflection, then describe well-being insights discovered through this process in approximately 500 characters.

resources: Smartphone-Compatible Art Apps (e.g., Adobe Sketch, Canva)
Asynchronous discussion platform (KakaoTalk Open Chat, Padlet, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
